intro: Nonatelia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered nonatelia, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
